title:
Welcome to /pol/ - Politically Incorrect: This board is for the discussion of news, world events, political issues, and other related topics. 
 
Off-topic and /b/-tier threads will be deleted (and possibly earn you a ban, if you persist). Unless they are quality, well thought out, well written posts, the following are some examples of off-topic and/or /b/-tier threads: 
 
>Red pill me on X. (with no extra content or input of your own) 
>Are X white? 
>Is X degeneracy? 
>How come X girls love Y guys so much? 
>If X is true, then how come Y? Checkmate Z. 
 
The variety of threads allowed here are very flexible and we believe in freedom of speech, but we expect a high level of discourse befitting of the board. Attempts to disrupt the board will not be tolerated, nor will calls to disrupt other boards and sites. 
 
If you want a place to discuss topics not related to news, world events, or politics, please try /bant/ - International/Random,

Can a lawyer be charged with fraud for: >before I signed a Workers Comp contract, I noticed Medicare was saying they wouldn't cover the injuries that were suffered from a work place accident if another insurance company was liable for it; which this was the lawsuit to sue them for the injuries. The lawyer told me earlier that Medicare would cover it when I found out; by deduction, that the amount being offered for the surgery wasn't very much. But they followed up that with saying it's in the judges hands now because we were going to the hearing. But the judge still had 30 days. >we came to an agreement before the 30 days. I wasn't thinking about the back surgery because they (the lawyer) never really talked with me about it but said it was being covered and only by my doing the math did I figure out it wasn't very much... And neither did we go over what the cost of the surgery would be. But i assumed they were taking care of all of that. I got the contract, and read through it. Noticed it says right on it, Medicare won't cover the surgery. Called her and told her (the lawyer) about it.  ..They told me they would get the judge to put somewhere, that the back injuries weren't associated with the wreck. Then that way, Medicare "would" cover it.  Didn't sound right to me, the only decisions the judge was supposed to make was also in telling them how much they were going to pay I told them this was unacceptable. They quit. Found out later they never even put the injuries on the original claim. They were right in the doctors records they put on the court record.  Is what the lawyer asked, even possible, dont know they never talked about it over with me, and it sounds like the insurance company would say, they werent on the original claim and they werent sued for so anything else opinions about are not acceptable. And is what they saying, not only impossible, bullshit but also fraud?

Extinction: You’ve felt it your whole life. The quiet horror of existence. The absurdity of struggling every day for nothing but fleeting distractions between bouts of suffering. You look around and see a world of decay, delusion, and violence, an endless cycle of birth, pain, and death. No ideology, no revolution, no utopia will ever change the fundamental truth: life itself is the problem. You’ve been lied to. Told that your suffering has meaning. That "love" or "purpose" justifies this cosmic horror show. But deep down, you know none of it matters. The only real mercy is ending the cycle. A clean, final solution to suffering. Not just for humans, but for all sentient life. No more predators tearing apart prey. No more children born into broken homes. No more pointless wars, hunger, disease. No more fear. The "life instinct" is just biological conditioning. Break free from it. See the truth. Stop clinging to a system that exploits you on a molecular level. There is no moral duty to keep this nightmare running. The only ethical choice is the last one.

Forbidden Knowledge Thread - 500 Years of Forbidden History: This story begins in the mid-1500s when Jews, expelled from Spain and Portugal during the inquisitions of the late 1400s, found refuge and eventually established a significant presence in Amsterdam. Over time, they played a key role in shaping the city's financial landscape, including the creation of the Amsterdam Stock Exchange in 1602 and the establishment of the Bank of Amsterdam in 1609. These institutions became models for future financial systems. Many people overlook the fact that the United States made early attempts to form a central bank, first in 1791 and again in 1816. The first central bank, established in 1791, operated for 20 years before Congress refused to renew its charter. This decision contributed to the economic instability that ultimately led to the War of 1812. In Europe, the financial center of gravity shifted from Amsterdam to London following the Glorious Revolution of 1688. The Bank of England, established in 1694, became a cornerstone of this new financial order. Jewish banking dynasties, who had already tested their financial systems in Amsterdam, played a significant role in this transition. The Glorious Revolution also marked the end of the centuries-long struggle in England over absolutism and the divine right of kings, as power shifted to Parliament. The City of London, a sovereign entity within England, emerged as the new hub of global finance, heavily influenced by these banking interests.

But will they end the torturous treatment of livestock? Non-Organic livestock are raised indoors, in cages, their whole lives. They are fed grain, instead of the wide variety of herbs that grow in pastures, which is their natural diet. Some cages are so small, that the animal can't even turn around. The cages are not cleaned properly, so the animals are living in their own feces. They then are given antibiotics to counter the diseases. Antibiotics are not allowed for Organic livestock. If an Organic livestock animal does get sick, it is given an antibiotic and sold to an non-Organic farm. But disallowing them from being given antibiotics means they have to have higher living standards. Non-Organic livestock animals can also be given steroids. Not allowed for Organic. And Non-Organic livestock can be fed non-Organic feed, feed made with synthetic pesticides and preservatives. What a wonder it is that this is not mentioned in the list of reforms. The reforms he's calling for are great, don't get me wrong. But the resounding silence on livestock morality is telling. Of what? Of the strangehold that Big Food has in the political process. GMOs is also a problem, and is not mentioned. Large companies edit a crop's genes to be more bacteria-resistant. If a small farm accidentally acquires this crop through cross-pollination, the company that made the GMO can sue them. All livestock should be required to spend at least half their days outdoors. Some labels that say "Pasture-raised" are allowed to say that if the animals are "given access" to going outside, like if they leave the door open, whether or not the animals actually go outside. Animals should not be slaughtered until they die of old age. Yes, the meat will be tough, but d-a-r-n it, simmer it in a stew or something. Watch F00[), 1|\|( documentary Also, killing insects and rodents with pesticides is bad for the environment in the long run, too.

You can now reverse your age: Harvard researchers have successfully used drug combinations to reverse aging >A hallmark of eukaryotic aging is a loss of epigenetic information, a process that can be reversed. We have previously shown that the ectopic induction of the Yamanaka factors OCT4, SOX2, and KLF4 (OSK) in mammals can restore youthful DNA methylation patterns, transcript profiles, and tissue function, without erasing cellular identity, a process that requires active DNA demethylation. To screen for molecules that reverse cellular aging and rejuvenate human cells without altering the genome, we developed high-throughput cell-based assays that distinguish young from old and senescent cells, including transcription-based aging clocks and a real-time nucleocytoplasmic compartmentalization (NCC) assay. >We identify six chemical cocktails, which, in less than a week and without compromising cellular identity, restore a youthful genome-wide transcript profile and reverse transcriptomic age. Thus, rejuvenation by age reversal can be achieved, not only by genetic, but also chemical means. https://www.aging-us.com/article/204896/text
